channel.title: Media | Dr. Luz Angélica Caudillo Mata

item.title: Finalist — Women in AI North America Awards 2025: AI in Industry Award, Innovator of the Year (Private Sector)
item.description:
I’m thrilled to announce that I’ve been named a finalist for the Women in AI North America Awards 2025, in the category AI in Industry Award - Innovator of the Year Private Sector.

The Women in AI North America Awards honor top female innovators, researchers, and leaders in artificial intelligence across Canada, Mexico, and USA. Being selected as a finalist in the AI Industry Award - Innovator of the Year Private Sector category recognizes significant contributions and leadership in AI within the private sector. The awards ceremony will take place on June 6th, 2025 in Toronto, Canada, celebrating the achievements of women shaping the future of AI.

For more information about the awards and to view the full list of finalists, visit the official finalists announcement in the Women in AI website.

item.title: Featured in The Logic — CIFAR Summer School as a Launchpad for Future AI Leaders
item.description:
I was included in The Logic’s article titled “Future leaders: Inside the Canadian summer school that’s a global hothouse for AI talent”.

The article reflects on 20 years of the CIFAR Deep Learning + Reinforcement Learning Summer School and its role in shaping global AI leadership. The piece highlights past and present participants, including my own path from academic research to AI leadership at MDA Space, as examples of the school’s lasting impact.

The Logic article: read it here .

item.title: Panelist — CIFAR DLRL 20th Anniversary Alumni Panel: Charting Your Path in AI
item.description:
I was honored to join fellow alumni as a panelist at the 20th-anniversary edition of the CIFAR Deep Learning + Reinforcement Learning Summer School. The panel, Charting Your Path in AI, brought together voices across academia and industry to reflect on our respective career journeys in AI.

The DLRL Summer School has been a pivotal platform for fostering the next generation of AI talent, bringing together nearly 200 trainees from 25 countries for ten days of intensive learning and networking. The 20th-anniversary celebration underscored the program’s enduring impact on the global AI community.

For more details on the event and its significance, please refer to CIFAR’s official post.

item.title: Invited Industry Contributor - CIFAR Symposium on AI for Energy & the Environment
item.description:
I was honored to contribute thought leadership as an invited industry participant at CIFAR’s AI for Energy & the Environment Symposium.

The symposium is a collaborative workshop bringing together leaders from academia, government, industry, and philanthropy to guide the next phase of the Pan-Canadian AI Strategy. I shared insights on the role of AI in sustainable innovation and was featured in the official symposium video.

Insights from the symposium were captured in a final report outlining key recommendations for advancing AI in sustainable energy and environmental stewardship.

Read more: CIFAR Blog Post.

Final Report: CIFAR Symposium on AI for Energy and the Environment (June 2023)

item.title: Podcast Guest - AI The New Sexy: Aplicaciones de Geointeligencia
item.description: Fui invitada al pódcast AI The New Sexy para conversar sobre mi trayectoria profesional y las aplicaciones de la inteligencia artificial en el campo de la geointeligencia. Hablamos sobre cómo la IA se aplica en la observación terrestre, el monitoreo ambiental, y cómo estas tecnologías pueden beneficiar a la sociedad. También compartí mi experiencia trabajando en Canadá, y mi participación en iniciativas comunitarias en IA.

item.title: Lathisms Calendar Honoree — Celebrating Latinx Excellence in Mathematics (2021)
item.description:
I was honored to be featured as a 2021 Honoree in the Lathisms Calendar, an initiative that celebrates the contributions of outstanding Latinx and Hispanic mathematicians to the mathematical sciences. This recognition highlights excellence not only in research and teaching, but also in mentorship and efforts to promote diversity and inclusion in STEM. The calendar serves as a platform to elevate visible role models and inspire the next generation of mathematicians.

View my feature: Lathisms 2021 Calendar — Luz Angelica Caudillo Mata

See all 2021 honorees: Lathisms 2021 Full Calendar

item.title: Selected Participant — Facebook F8 Hackathon & Developer Conference (2019)
item.description:
I was honored to be selected as one of only 200 participants (from over 4,000 applicants worldwide) to attend the F8 Hackathon, part of Facebook’s annual developer conference. The event brought together developers from across the globe in a vibrant and collaborative atmosphere to build tech-driven solutions for social good. I joined an incredible team under the name #StrongerTogether, and we formed not only a strong project but also lasting friendships.

Special thanks to the organizers, particularly Joe Darko, for the outstanding leadership and flawless execution of the hackathon, and to Meta for the travel award that supported my participation. I’m truly grateful for this energizing experience and proud to contribute to projects with meaningful impact.

View our project: #StrongerTogether Hackathon Submision

item.title: Recognized as a 2019 Rising Star in Computational & Data Sciences
item.description:
I was honored to be selected as a Rising Star in Computational and Data Sciences in 2019, a highly competitive program hosted by the Oden Institute for Computational Engineering and Sciences at UT Austin, in partnership with Sandia and Lawrence Livermore National Laboratories. With an acceptance rate of just 21% that year, the workshop brought together top early-career researchers in computational and data science for an intensive program of research presentations, career development sessions, and community building, all aimed at shaping the next generation of academic and research leaders.

About the program: Rising Stars in Computational & Data Sciences

item.title: Selected Attendee — Facebook F8 Developer Conference (2018)
item.description: I was selected to attend the Facebook F8 Developers Conference and was granted a travel award by the Lean In Computer Science & Engineering Student Chapter. Held in San Jose, California, the conference brought together a global community of developers and innovators to explore the future of technology across platforms such as AI, AR/VR, and data privacy.

item.title: Featured Poster Presenter - NERSC, Berkely National Lab (2016)
item.description:
As a research intern at the National Energy Research Scientific Computing Center (NERSC) at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory, I presented a poster on high-performance computational methods for geophysical modeling. This work, conducted during my PhD at the University of British Columbia, explored scalable approaches for scientific computing and contributed to research efforts at NERSC. Sharing this work in a leading national lab environment was an incredibly valuable and formative experience.

View the post: Facebook - Berkely Lab Poster Presentation

Learn about the program: Berkely Lab Computing Sciences Summer Student Program

item.title: Poster Symposium Awardee - Lawrence Livermore National Lab (2015)
item.description:
During my 2015 internship at the Center for Applied Scientific Computing (CASC) at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL), I was honored with a Special Recognition Award at the annual Student Poster Symposium for my project titled “Numerical Upscaling of Maxwell’s Equations.” This symposium, the largest to date with over 250 participants, showcased the collaborative research efforts between students and LLNL mentors across various scientific and technical disciplines. Only 11% of the presenters got an award.

The recognition highlighted the significance of my work in computational electromagnetics and underscored LLNL’s commitment to fostering emerging talent in STEM fields. I am grateful for the mentorship and support received during this experience, which has been instrumental in my professional development.

Read more: LLNL News — Students Shine at Summer Poster Symposium

item.title: Recipient of the Technological Innovation Award for '5ta Fachada' - Granted by the Science and Technology Council of the State of Guanajuato (CONCYTEG, 2010)
item.description:
Ganadora del Premio a la Innovación Tecnológica por “5ta Fachada” — Otorgado por CONCyTEG y el Gobierno del Estado de Guanajuato (2010)

Durante mi trabajo en la primera etapa del proyecto “5ta Fachada” (2009–2010), como parte de un equipo multidisciplinario entre el Centro de Investigación en Matemáticas (CIMAT) y la empresa Tejas el Águila, contribuí al desarrollo de un software innovador que optimiza el diseño estructural y la visualización 3D de techos pre-armados. Este software, conocido como 5ta Fachada, permite simulaciones estructurales, optimización de materiales, cálculo de costos, y cumple con normativas de construcción.

El proyecto fue galardonado con el Primer Lugar en la categoría de Innovación Tecnológica para Empresarios y Emprendedores (subcategoría senior) en el Tercer Premio a la Innovación Tecnológica Guanajuato 2010, reconociendo su alto impacto técnico y comercial.

Me desempeñé como sublíder técnica del proyecto, encargándome del diseño de la interfaz gráfica, la base de datos y la coordinación del equipo para asegurar el cumplimiento de los objetivos técnicos y de desarrollo.

Leer estudio de caso: Capital Social e Innovación — La Quinta Fachada (Dialnet)
